page.title: 06AGRICULTURE
page.content: There are also Welsh crossbred ewes, Suffolk rams and pigs.The crops grown are barley, potatoes, cabbage,sprouts, carrots, beans, cauliflowers, broccoli,turnips, oats, hay, and grass for pastureand silage.Silage is stored in large black polythene bags which are held down by heavy tyres to compress the grass.The customers for the produce include,private customers for the milk but the vast majority of the milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board which makes a range of dairy products.The large farms are mainly family run, so they have a great deal of machinery such as tractors, combine harvesters,bale grabber and a meal hopper.The major products of the area are wool, mutton, milk, vegetables, bacon and ceral crops.Most of the products are sold in local markets in Chester and Deeside.
